meanings.definition: The quality or state of having multiple meanings or interpretations.
meanings.sent1: The multivalences of the word 'run' can lead to confusion in language learners.
meanings.sent2: The multivalences of the term 'love' make it a complex concept to define.
meanings.sent3: The teacher's multivalences of the word 'banana' in class had everyone laughing.
meanings.sent4: Her multivalences of the phrase 'time flies' brought a new perspective to the saying.
meanings.sent5: The multivalences of the term 'success' can vary greatly from person to person.

meanings.definition: The ability to exist in multiple forms or states.
meanings.sent1: The multivalences of water as ice, liquid, and vapor are fascinating.
meanings.sent2: The multivalences of a caterpillar transforming into a butterfly showcase nature's wonders.
meanings.sent3: The multivalences of a chameleon changing colors amazed the children at the zoo.
meanings.sent4: His multivalences of adapting to different situations made him a valuable team member.
meanings.sent5: The multivalences of a seed growing into a plant demonstrate the cycle of life.
